Assessments_v2_attemptResult.title: AWS Certified Cloud Practitioner - Practice Exam (CLF-C01) - 4

domainGradeBreakdown.domainDescription: This represents exam questions for the Cloud Computing section.
This represents exam questions for the Security & Compliance section.
This represents exam questions for the Technology section.
This represents exam questions for the Billing & Pricing section.

questions.questionText: A development team wants to gain full observability into the health of their applications and instances in order to provide the best service level to users of their applications. Which services can help them monitor the health of their applications and instances?

choices.explanation: Route 53 can be used to configure DNS health checks to route traffic to healthy endpoints or to monitor the health of your applications.
While CloudTrail tracks user activity and API calls within your account, it does not monitor the health of applications and instances.
Load balancers monitor the health of EC2 instances and route the traffic to only instances that are in a healthy state.
Elastic Beanstalk monitors application health via a health dashboard.
SNS allows you to send emails and text messages from your applications.

correctAnswers.explanation: Route 53 can be used to configure DNS health checks to route traffic to healthy endpoints or to monitor the health of your applications.
Load balancers monitor the health of EC2 instances and route the traffic to only instances that are in a healthy state.
Elastic Beanstalk monitors application health via a health dashboard.

incorrectSelectedAnswers.explanation: SNS allows you to send emails and text messages from your applications.

questions.questionText: You are an AWS Enterprise customer with questions about billing and your overall AWS account. Which of the following AWS Support personnel should you contact?

choices.explanation: This is not a viable option.
The TAM assigned via the Enterprise Support plan is not the best place to start.
AWS Support is not the best place to start.

For AWS Enterprise customers, the AWS Concierge is a resource dedicated to answering billing and account questions.
https://www.amazonaws.cn/en/support/features/

correctAnswers.explanation:
For AWS Enterprise customers, the AWS Concierge is a resource dedicated to answering billing and account questions.
https://www.amazonaws.cn/en/support/features/

questions.questionText: A company would like to call AWS support to open cases when issues arise. What's the minimum support plan they need to subscribe to in order to have telephone access?

choices.explanation: Business Support is the minimum plan that provides access to support via telephone.
Basic Support doesn't provide access via telephone.
Enterprise Support provides access to telephone support, but it is not the minimum.
Developer Support doesn't provide access via telephone.

correctAnswers.explanation: Business Support is the minimum plan that provides access to support via telephone.

questions.questionText: Which of the following are programmatic access types enabling users to interact with AWS services?

choices.explanation: IAM users can make API calls for programmatic access to AWS services. [Creating IAM users - AWS API](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/IAM/latest/UserGuide/id_users_create.html#id_users_create_api).

The AWS Command Line Interface (CLI) is a unified tool to manage your AWS services. With just one tool to download and configure, you can control multiple AWS services from the command line and automate them through scripts. [AWS Command Line Interface](https://aws.amazon.com/cli/).
Python is a computer programming language and alone does not provide programmatic access to AWS services.

AWS SDKs allow IAM users to make programmatic API calls AWS services. The AWS SDKs consist of libraries and sample code for various programming languages and platforms (for example, Java, Ruby, .NET, iOS, and Android). The SDKs provide a convenient way to create programmatic access to IAM and AWS. For example, the SDKs take care of tasks such as cryptographically signing requests, managing errors, and retrying requests automatically. [IAM API Reference](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/IAM/latest/APIReference/Welcome.html).

correctAnswers.explanation: IAM users can make API calls for programmatic access to AWS services. [Creating IAM users - AWS API](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/IAM/latest/UserGuide/id_users_create.html#id_users_create_api).

The AWS Command Line Interface (CLI) is a unified tool to manage your AWS services. With just one tool to download and configure, you can control multiple AWS services from the command line and automate them through scripts. [AWS Command Line Interface](https://aws.amazon.com/cli/).

AWS SDKs allow IAM users to make programmatic API calls AWS services. The AWS SDKs consist of libraries and sample code for various programming languages and platforms (for example, Java, Ruby, .NET, iOS, and Android). The SDKs provide a convenient way to create programmatic access to IAM and AWS. For example, the SDKs take care of tasks such as cryptographically signing requests, managing errors, and retrying requests automatically. [IAM API Reference](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/IAM/latest/APIReference/Welcome.html).

questions.questionText: When you access tools provided to build a storefront application that runs on another company’s server, which cloud computing model are you using?

choices.explanation: FaaS allows you to execute code in response to events.
IaaS offers building blocks that can be rented. When you pay a web hosting fee, you're using IaaS.
PaaS is often used by developers to develop software using web-based tools.
SaaS allows you to use a complete application on demand. When you access your personal email through a web browser, you're using SaaS.

correctAnswers.explanation: PaaS is often used by developers to develop software using web-based tools.

incorrectSelectedAnswers.explanation: SaaS allows you to use a complete application on demand. When you access your personal email through a web browser, you're using SaaS.

questions.questionText: Which of the following is NOT part of the AWS Global infrastructure?

choices.explanation: Edge locations cache content for fast delivery to your users.
Availability Zones (AZs) consist of 1 or more physically separated data centers, each with redundant power, networking, and connectivity, housed in separate facilities.

Regions, AZs, and edge locations are part of the AWS Global Infrastructure.
https://aws.amazon.com/about-aws/global-infrastructure/
A Region is a physical location. AWS logically groups its Regions into geographic locations.

correctAnswers.explanation:
Regions, AZs, and edge locations are part of the AWS Global Infrastructure.
https://aws.amazon.com/about-aws/global-infrastructure/

questions.questionText: You need to track your AWS costs on a detailed level. Which tool will allow you to do this?

choices.explanation:
Organizations can provide consolidated billing but not the granular billing desired in this scenario.
https://aws.amazon.com/organizations/

A tag is a label that you or AWS assign to an AWS resource. Each tag consists of a key and a value. Tagged resources can appear on the Cost Explorer or on a cost allocation report.
https://docs.aws.amazon.com/awsaccountbilling/latest/aboutv2/cost-alloc-tags.html

CloudWatch is a monitoring and observability service built for DevOps engineers, developers, site reliability engineers (SREs), and IT managers. CloudWatch provides you with data and actionable insights to monitor your applications, respond to system-wide performance changes, optimize resource utilization, and get a unified view of operational health. It does not track your costs.
https://aws.amazon.com/cloudwatch/

AWS CloudTrail can provide auditing on all activity in your account, but it will not provide billing information.
https://aws.amazon.com/cloudtrail/

correctAnswers.explanation:
A tag is a label that you or AWS assign to an AWS resource. Each tag consists of a key and a value. Tagged resources can appear on the Cost Explorer or on a cost allocation report.
https://docs.aws.amazon.com/awsaccountbilling/latest/aboutv2/cost-alloc-tags.html

questions.questionText: Which of the following are focuses of the cost optimization pillar of the Well-Architected Framework?

choices.explanation: This is a focus of the cost optimization pillar. This pillar focuses on delivering optimum and resilient solutions at the least cost to the user.

choices.text: Pay for extra resources to cover demand.
choices.explanation: This is not a focus of the cost optimization pillar. Instead, you should pay only for resources your application requires.
This is a focus of the cost optimization pillar. This pillar focuses on delivering optimum and resilient solutions at the least cost to the user.
This is a focus of the cost optimization pillar. This pillar focuses on delivering optimum and resilient solutions at the least cost to the user.

correctAnswers.explanation: This is a focus of the cost optimization pillar. This pillar focuses on delivering optimum and resilient solutions at the least cost to the user.
This is a focus of the cost optimization pillar. This pillar focuses on delivering optimum and resilient solutions at the least cost to the user.
This is a focus of the cost optimization pillar. This pillar focuses on delivering optimum and resilient solutions at the least cost to the user.

questions.questionText: You would like to give an application running on one of your EC2 instances access to an S3 bucket. What is the best way to implement this?

choices.text: Assign the instance an IAM role
choices.explanation:
The recommended method to assign permissions to apps running in EC2 is to use IAM roles.
https://docs.aws.amazon.com/IAM/latest/UserGuide/best-practices.html

choices.text: Use an IAM user for the application
choices.explanation: This is less secure than using IAM roles and is not recommended in this case.

choices.text: Give the application a set of access keys
choices.explanation: This is less secure than using IAM roles and is not recommended in this case.
Making the bucket public could work, but will also expose all the data to the internet and is not secure.

correctAnswers.text: Assign the instance an IAM role
correctAnswers.explanation:
The recommended method to assign permissions to apps running in EC2 is to use IAM roles.
https://docs.aws.amazon.com/IAM/latest/UserGuide/best-practices.html

incorrectSelectedAnswers.text: Give the application a set of access keys
incorrectSelectedAnswers.explanation: This is less secure than using IAM roles and is not recommended in this case.

questions.questionText: When you pay a subscription fee to a hosting company to serve your website on an instance you manage, which cloud computing model are you using?

choices.explanation: SaaS allows you to use a complete application on demand.
FaaS allows you to execute code in response to events.
IaaS offers building blocks that can be rented. When you pay a web hosting fee, you're using IaaS.
PaaS is often used by developers to develop software using web-based tools.

correctAnswers.explanation: IaaS offers building blocks that can be rented. When you pay a web hosting fee, you're using IaaS.

incorrectSelectedAnswers.explanation: PaaS is often used by developers to develop software using web-based tools.

questions.questionText: Which of the following are design principles from the security pillar of the AWS Well-Architected Framework?

choices.explanation:
Perform operations as code is one of the operational excellence pillar design principles that can help you to run cloud workloads effectively, gain insight into operations, and continuously improve supporting processes to deliver business value. [AWS Well-Architected Framework > Operational Excellence > Design Principles
](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/wellarchitected/latest/operational-excellence-pillar/design-principles.html).

Use serverless architectures is one of the performance efficiency design principles that can help you achieve and maintain efficient workloads in the cloud. AWS Documentation: [AWS Well-Architected Framework > Performance Efficiency Pillar > Design Principles](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/wellarchitected/latest/performance-efficiency-pillar/design-principles.html).

choices.text: Protect data in transit and at rest
choices.explanation: Protect data in transit and at rest is one of the security pillar design principles that can help you strengthen your workload's security in the cloud. AWS Documentation: [AWS Well-Architected Framework > Security Foundations](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/wellarchitected/latest/security-pillar/security.html).

Apply security at all layers is one of the security pillar design principles that can help you strengthen your workload's security in the cloud. AWS Documentation: [AWS Well-Architected Framework > Security Foundations](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/wellarchitected/latest/security-pillar/security.html).

Enable traceability is one of the security pillar design principles that can help you strengthen your workload's security in the cloud. AWS Documentation: [AWS Well-Architected Framework > Security Foundations](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/wellarchitected/latest/security-pillar/security.html).

correctAnswers.text: Protect data in transit and at rest
correctAnswers.explanation: Protect data in transit and at rest is one of the security pillar design principles that can help you strengthen your workload's security in the cloud. AWS Documentation: [AWS Well-Architected Framework > Security Foundations](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/wellarchitected/latest/security-pillar/security.html).

Apply security at all layers is one of the security pillar design principles that can help you strengthen your workload's security in the cloud. AWS Documentation: [AWS Well-Architected Framework > Security Foundations](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/wellarchitected/latest/security-pillar/security.html).

Enable traceability is one of the security pillar design principles that can help you strengthen your workload's security in the cloud. AWS Documentation: [AWS Well-Architected Framework > Security Foundations](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/wellarchitected/latest/security-pillar/security.html).

questions.questionText: How is data defined when it is moving from one location to another?

choices.explanation: Data in flight (or in transit) describes data that is moving from one location to another.
Data at rest is data that is inactive or stored for later use.
The correct terminology is data in flight (or in transit).
The correct terminology is data in flight (or in transit).

correctAnswers.explanation: Data in flight (or in transit) describes data that is moving from one location to another.

questions.questionText: Which of the following best describes a system that will remain operational even in the event of a component failure?

choices.explanation: Scalability provides consistent performance as a system handles growing workload requirements.
Highly available systems are designed to operate continuously *without* failure for a long time.
With elasticity, you do not have to plan ahead of time how much capacity you need. You can provision only what you need, and then grow and shrink based on demand based on workload changes.

A fault-tolerant system will remain operational even in the event of a component failure.
[Reliability Pillar - AWS Well-Architected Framework](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/wellarchitected/latest/reliability-pillar/welcome.html)

correctAnswers.explanation:
A fault-tolerant system will remain operational even in the event of a component failure.
[Reliability Pillar - AWS Well-Architected Framework](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/wellarchitected/latest/reliability-pillar/welcome.html)

incorrectSelectedAnswers.explanation: Highly available systems are designed to operate continuously *without* failure for a long time.

questions.questionText: A developer has created an application that will allow viewers of a popular TV show to vote for their favorite contestants. They expect to have 50 million viewers all voting at the same time at the end of each performance. When designing the system, they want to keep the voting and tallying functionality as separate standalone components. Which service will promote loose coupling between the 2 components using asynchronous integration?

choices.explanation: SES is an email service that allows you to send richly formatted HTML emails from your applications.
IAM allows you to control access to your AWS services and resources.
SQS is a message queuing service that allows you to build loosely coupled systems with asynchronous messaging and integration.
SNS is a notification service that allows you to send text messages and emails.

correctAnswers.explanation: SQS is a message queuing service that allows you to build loosely coupled systems with asynchronous messaging and integration.

questions.questionText: You have decided to use the AWS Cost and Usage Report to track your EC2 Reserved Instance costs. Which AWS service can be used to store AWS Cost and Usage report files?

choices.explanation:
Log files can be stored in CloudWatch, but you cannot publish the reports here.
https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonCloudWatch/latest/logs/WhatIsCloudWatchLogs.html

You cannot store the Cost and Usage Report in a bucket owned by AWS.
https://docs.aws.amazon.com/cur/latest/userguide/what-is-cur.html

You cannot store the Cost and Usage Report in Trusted Advisor.
AWS Trusted Advisor is an online tool that provides you real-time guidance to help you provision your resources following AWS best practices. Trusted Advisor checks help optimize your AWS infrastructure, increase security and performance, reduce your overall costs, and monitor service limits.
https://aws.amazon.com/premiumsupport/technology/trusted-advisor/

You can use Cost and Usage Reports to publish your AWS billing reports to an S3 bucket you own. AWS updates the report in your bucket once a day in comma-separated value (CSV) format. You can view the reports using spreadsheet software or access them from an application using the Amazon S3 API.
https://docs.aws.amazon.com/cur/latest/userguide/what-is-cur.html

correctAnswers.explanation:
You can use Cost and Usage Reports to publish your AWS billing reports to an S3 bucket you own. AWS updates the report in your bucket once a day in comma-separated value (CSV) format. You can view the reports using spreadsheet software or access them from an application using the Amazon S3 API.
https://docs.aws.amazon.com/cur/latest/userguide/what-is-cur.html

incorrectSelectedAnswers.explanation:
You cannot store the Cost and Usage Report in Trusted Advisor.
AWS Trusted Advisor is an online tool that provides you real-time guidance to help you provision your resources following AWS best practices. Trusted Advisor checks help optimize your AWS infrastructure, increase security and performance, reduce your overall costs, and monitor service limits.
https://aws.amazon.com/premiumsupport/technology/trusted-advisor/

questions.questionText: Which of the following AWS Support levels offers 24x7 support via phone or chat?

choices.explanation:
The Business and Enterprise support plans, the two most expensive plans, offer 24 X 7 support via phone or chat.
https://aws.amazon.com/premiumsupport/plans/
Developer does not offer 24x7 support via phone or chat.
Individual is not a support plan offered by AWS Support.
Basic does not offer 24x7 support via phone or chat.

correctAnswers.explanation:
The Business and Enterprise support plans, the two most expensive plans, offer 24 X 7 support via phone or chat.
https://aws.amazon.com/premiumsupport/plans/

incorrectSelectedAnswers.explanation: Developer does not offer 24x7 support via phone or chat.

questions.questionText: You need to store a collection of objects that can also be accessed from a different AWS Region. Which service should you use to do this?

choices.explanation: Fargate is a serverless compute engine for containers.
EBS is a storage device (called a volume) that can be attached to (or removed from) your instance.

S3 allows you to access objects from anywhere in the world - as long as the appropriate permissions are set!
https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonS3/latest/dev/Welcome.html
DynamoDB is a fully managed NoSQL key-value and document database.

correctAnswers.explanation:
S3 allows you to access objects from anywhere in the world - as long as the appropriate permissions are set!
https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonS3/latest/dev/Welcome.html

questions.questionText: According to the Shared Responsibility Model, which of the following is AWS responsible for?

choices.explanation: This is your responsibility.

Protecting the infrastructure that runs all of the services in the AWS Cloud is the responsibility of AWS. Such services include EC2 infrastructure — the hardware compute platform for running EC2 instances and Amazon Virtual Private Cloud — or VPC, which enables customers to provision a logically isolated section of the AWS Cloud to launch their resources. The subnets, security groups, and network access control lists configured in the VPC are the responsibility of the customer.
https://aws.amazon.com/compliance/shared-responsibility-model/
https://aws.amazon.com/vpc/
This is your responsibility.

Protecting the infrastructure that runs all of the services in the AWS Cloud is the responsibility of AWS. Such services include EC2 infrastructure — the hardware compute platform for running EC2 instances and Amazon Virtual Private Cloud — or VPC, which enables customers to provision a logically isolated section of the AWS Cloud to launch their resources. The subnets, security groups, and network access control lists configured in the VPC are the responsibility of the customer.
https://aws.amazon.com/compliance/shared-responsibility-model/
https://aws.amazon.com/vpc/
This is your responsibility.

correctAnswers.explanation:
Protecting the infrastructure that runs all of the services in the AWS Cloud is the responsibility of AWS. Such services include EC2 infrastructure — the hardware compute platform for running EC2 instances and Amazon Virtual Private Cloud — or VPC, which enables customers to provision a logically isolated section of the AWS Cloud to launch their resources. The subnets, security groups, and network access control lists configured in the VPC are the responsibility of the customer.
https://aws.amazon.com/compliance/shared-responsibility-model/
https://aws.amazon.com/vpc/

Protecting the infrastructure that runs all of the services in the AWS Cloud is the responsibility of AWS. Such services include EC2 infrastructure — the hardware compute platform for running EC2 instances and Amazon Virtual Private Cloud — or VPC, which enables customers to provision a logically isolated section of the AWS Cloud to launch their resources. The subnets, security groups, and network access control lists configured in the VPC are the responsibility of the customer.
https://aws.amazon.com/compliance/shared-responsibility-model/
https://aws.amazon.com/vpc/

questions.questionText: When you access your personal email through a web browser using an application like Gmail, which cloud computing model are you using?

choices.explanation: PaaS is often used by developers to develop software using web-based tools.
IaaS offers building blocks that can be rented. When you pay a web hosting fee, you're using IaaS.
FaaS allows you to execute code in response to events.
SaaS allows you to use a complete application on demand. When you access your personal email through a web browser, you're using SaaS.

correctAnswers.explanation: SaaS allows you to use a complete application on demand. When you access your personal email through a web browser, you're using SaaS.

questions.questionText: A company wants to build a customer identity graph to provide a single unified view of customers and prospects by linking identifiers like website browsing history, preferences, and more. Which database product allows the customer to store and navigate billions of interconnected relationships?

choices.explanation: DocumentDB is a fully managed document database that supports MongoDB.
Aurora is a relational database compatible with MySQL and PostgreSQL that was created by AWS.
DynamoDB is a fully managed NoSQL key-value and document database.
Neptune is a fully managed graph database that supports highly connected datasets.

correctAnswers.explanation: Neptune is a fully managed graph database that supports highly connected datasets.

questions.questionText: You need a "virtual hard disk" for your EC2 instance. Which of the following should you choose?

choices.explanation: VPC is a foundational service that allows you to create a secure private network in the AWS Cloud where you launch your resources.

EBS volumes are "virtual hard disks" for your EC2 instance.

https://aws.amazon.com/ebs/
S3 is an object storage service for the cloud that is highly available.
RDS is a service that makes it easy to launch and manage relational databases.

correctAnswers.explanation:
EBS volumes are "virtual hard disks" for your EC2 instance.

https://aws.amazon.com/ebs/

questions.questionText: You are gathering information to present to management on a potential move to the AWS Cloud. Can you identify advantages of cloud computing?

choices.explanation:
With the cloud, there is less of a need to predict your capacity. When you make a capacity decision prior to deploying an application, you often end up either sitting on expensive idle resources or dealing with limited capacity. With cloud computing, these problems go away. You can access as much or as little capacity as you need, and scale up and down as required with only a few minutes’ notice.
https://docs.aws.amazon.com/whitepapers/latest/aws-overview/six-advantages-of-cloud-computing.html

In a cloud computing environment, new IT resources are only a click away, which means you reduce the time to make those resources available to your developers from weeks to just minutes. This results in a dramatic increase in agility for the organization since the cost and time it takes to experiment and develop is significantly lower.

choices.text: Benefit from small economies of scale.
choices.explanation:
By using cloud computing, you can achieve a lower variable cost than you can get on your own. Because usage from hundreds of thousands of customers is aggregated in the cloud, AWS can achieve higher economies of scale, which translates into lower pay as-you-go prices.
https://docs.aws.amazon.com/whitepapers/latest/aws-overview/six-advantages-of-cloud-computing.html

choices.text: Trade capital expense for variable expense.
choices.explanation:
Instead of having to invest heavily in data centers and servers before you know how you’re going to use them, you can only pay when you consume computing resources and you only pay for how much you consume.
https://docs.aws.amazon.com/whitepapers/latest/aws-overview/six-advantages-of-cloud-computing.html

correctAnswers.explanation: In a cloud computing environment, new IT resources are only a click away, which means you reduce the time to make those resources available to your developers from weeks to just minutes. This results in a dramatic increase in agility for the organization since the cost and time it takes to experiment and develop is significantly lower.

correctAnswers.text: Trade capital expense for variable expense.
correctAnswers.explanation:
Instead of having to invest heavily in data centers and servers before you know how you’re going to use them, you can only pay when you consume computing resources and you only pay for how much you consume.
https://docs.aws.amazon.com/whitepapers/latest/aws-overview/six-advantages-of-cloud-computing.html

questions.questionText: A company is considering migrating to the cloud. How does moving to the cloud reduce upfront costs?

choices.text: By allowing the provisioning of resources at a fixed price even during high peak times
choices.explanation: The pay-as-you-go pricing model allows you to reduce upfront costs and spread costs over time.

choices.text: By replacing large capital expenditures with lower variable costs spread over time
choices.explanation: The cloud allows you to trade capital expenses for variable expenses.

choices.text: By allowing you to pay upfront for software to lock in savings
choices.explanation: The pay-as-you-go pricing model allows you to reduce upfront costs and spread costs over time.

choices.text: By replacing large variable expenditures with lower capital investments
choices.explanation: This is the exact opposite of what the cloud does. The cloud allows you to trade capital expenses for variable expenses.

correctAnswers.text: By replacing large capital expenditures with lower variable costs spread over time
correctAnswers.explanation: The cloud allows you to trade capital expenses for variable expenses.

questions.questionText: Which pillar of the Well-Architected Framework encourages performing operations as code (for example, encouraging the use of services such as CloudFormation) as one of its design principles?

choices.explanation: Operational excellence focuses on creating applications that effectively support production workloads. Scripting operations as code is part of this pillar, which includes the use of CloudFormation.

Performance efficiency focuses on the effective use of computing resources
to meet the system and business requirements while removing bottlenecks.
Reliability focuses on designing systems that work consistently and recover quickly.

Security focuses on putting mechanisms in place that help protect
your systems and data.

correctAnswers.explanation: Operational excellence focuses on creating applications that effectively support production workloads. Scripting operations as code is part of this pillar, which includes the use of CloudFormation.

questions.questionText: You have been tasked to create an S3 bucket for storing templates. A team member has forwarded you the templates, which are used for creating multiple different AWS resources such as S3 buckets, EC2 instances, and VPCs. Which service uses these templates to create AWS resources?

choices.explanation:
AWS OpsWorks is a configuration management service that provides managed instances of Chef and Puppet.
https://aws.amazon.com/opsworks/

You can use Elastic Beanstalk to create AWS environments, but it does not use templates.
https://aws.amazon.com/elasticbeanstalk/

CloudFormation allows you to provision AWS resources using Infrastructure as Code (IaC) and reusable templates.
https://aws.amazon.com/cloudformation/resources/templates/
EC2 instances can be created from launch configurations and launch templates (used with Auto Scaling). But these templates can only create EC2 instances, not other resources such as S3 buckets.

correctAnswers.explanation:
CloudFormation allows you to provision AWS resources using Infrastructure as Code (IaC) and reusable templates.
https://aws.amazon.com/cloudformation/resources/templates/

questions.questionText: Several EC2 instances in a public subnet need internet access. Which will you configure as 1 step in granting internet access?

choices.explanation:
Amazon API Gateway is a fully managed service that makes it easy to create and manage APIs.
https://aws.amazon.com/api-gateway/
VPC peering helps with access between 2 VPCs. It does not need to be configured to give instances in a public subnet access to the internet.
The NAT gateway resides in a public subnet, but it helps to provide internet access to instances in private subnets.

An internet gateway allows public traffic to the internet from a VPC.
https://docs.aws.amazon.com/vpc/latest/userguide/VPC_Internet_Gateway.html

correctAnswers.explanation:
An internet gateway allows public traffic to the internet from a VPC.
https://docs.aws.amazon.com/vpc/latest/userguide/VPC_Internet_Gateway.html

questions.questionText: Which of the below is correct when looking at Regions, Availability Zones, edge locations, and data centers?

choices.explanation: Edge locations are mini data centers that are closer to users than Regions or Availability Zones. They do not contain Availability Zones.

An Availability Zone (AZ) is one or more discrete data centers with redundant power, networking, and connectivity in an AWS Region. AWS Documentation: [Regions and Availability Zones](https://aws.amazon.com/about-aws/global-infrastructure/regions_az/).

Each AWS Region consists of a minimum of three, isolated, and physically separate AZs within a geographic area. AWS Documentation: [Regions and Availability Zones](https://aws.amazon.com/about-aws/global-infrastructure/regions_az/).
A group of logical data centers is called an Availability Zone, so Availability Zones contain data centers.

correctAnswers.explanation: An Availability Zone (AZ) is one or more discrete data centers with redundant power, networking, and connectivity in an AWS Region. AWS Documentation: [Regions and Availability Zones](https://aws.amazon.com/about-aws/global-infrastructure/regions_az/).

Each AWS Region consists of a minimum of three, isolated, and physically separate AZs within a geographic area. AWS Documentation: [Regions and Availability Zones](https://aws.amazon.com/about-aws/global-infrastructure/regions_az/).

questions.questionText: You need to host a file in a location that is publicly accessible from anywhere in the world. Which AWS service would meet that need at the lowest cost?

choices.explanation:
With S3, objects can be accessed from anywhere in the world via a public URL. An RDS instance is used for hosting databases. An EBS Volume requires an EC2 instance to be accessible and would be more expensive than using S3.
https://aws.amazon.com/s3/
EC2 allows you to rent and manage virtual servers in the cloud.
EBS is a storage device (called a volume) that can be attached to (or removed from) your instance.
RDS is a service that makes it easy to launch and manage relational databases.

correctAnswers.explanation:
With S3, objects can be accessed from anywhere in the world via a public URL. An RDS instance is used for hosting databases. An EBS Volume requires an EC2 instance to be accessible and would be more expensive than using S3.
https://aws.amazon.com/s3/

incorrectSelectedAnswers.explanation: RDS is a service that makes it easy to launch and manage relational databases.

questions.questionText: Several S3 buckets have been deleted, and a few EC2 instances have been terminated. Which AWS service can you use to determine who took these actions?

choices.explanation: Amazon Inspector is an automated security assessment service that helps improve the security and compliance of applications deployed on AWS.
CloudTrail provides the event history of your AWS account activity, including actions taken through the AWS Management Console, AWS SDKs, command line tools, and other AWS services.

CloudWatch provides events and alarms, and could potentially be set up to be triggered when an EC2 instance is terminated but will not provide detailed information over who and when the action was taken.
AWS Trusted Advisor is an application that draws upon best practices learned from AWS’ aggregated operational history of serving hundreds of thousands of AWS customers.

correctAnswers.explanation: CloudTrail provides the event history of your AWS account activity, including actions taken through the AWS Management Console, AWS SDKs, command line tools, and other AWS services.

questions.questionText: You have a mission-critical application that must be globally available at all times. Which deployment strategy should you follow?

choices.explanation: While this improves availability and is a best practice, there is a possibility that all Availability Zones in a single Region could fail.

choices.text: Deploy to all Availability Zones in your home region.
choices.explanation: While this improves availability and is a best practice, there is a possibility that all Availability Zones in a single Region could fail.

A multi-Region deployment will best ensure global availability. While it can be the most expensive, as well as complex to configure, multi-Regional architectures will ensure that even if all Availability Zones in a single Region fail due to a catastrophic event, your data will remain accessible.

While you can connect any 2 VPCs in different Regions, this may not maintain consistency of workloads across the Regions and does not necessarily mean requests will be deployed across multiple Regions.

correctAnswers.explanation: A multi-Region deployment will best ensure global availability. While it can be the most expensive, as well as complex to configure, multi-Regional architectures will ensure that even if all Availability Zones in a single Region fail due to a catastrophic event, your data will remain accessible.

questions.questionText: Which of the following scenarios are examples of scaling an IT architecture vertically?

choices.explanation: Adding more RDS instances is scaling horizontally because it involves the increase in the number of resources, rather than the increase in each resource's capabilities.
Adding more EC2 instances is scaling horizontally because it involves the increase in the number of resources, rather than the increase in each resource's capabilities.

choices.text: Resizing an RDS instance type from db.r5.large to db.r5.2xlarge
choices.explanation: To scale vertically is to increase the specifications of a single AWS resource as needed. For example, resizing RDS instances for more CPU, memory, or network capabilities is scaling vertically.

choices.text: Resizing an EC2 instance type from a1.medium to a1.xlarge for more CPU and memory power
choices.explanation: To scale vertically is to increase the specifications of a single AWS resource as needed. For example, resizing EC2 instances for more CPU, memory, or network capabilities is scaling vertically.

correctAnswers.text: Resizing an RDS instance type from db.r5.large to db.r5.2xlarge
correctAnswers.explanation: To scale vertically is to increase the specifications of a single AWS resource as needed. For example, resizing RDS instances for more CPU, memory, or network capabilities is scaling vertically.

correctAnswers.text: Resizing an EC2 instance type from a1.medium to a1.xlarge for more CPU and memory power
correctAnswers.explanation: To scale vertically is to increase the specifications of a single AWS resource as needed. For example, resizing EC2 instances for more CPU, memory, or network capabilities is scaling vertically.

questions.questionText: An IAM user with administrative access is attempting to close the AWS account. After troubleshooting, the admin user uncovers they need to sign in with root user credentials in order to perform this task. What other tasks require root user credentials?

choices.text: Changing the email address associated with the account
choices.explanation: This task can only be performed when you sign in as the root user of an account. AWS Documentation: [Tasks that require root user credentials](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/accounts/latest/reference/root-user-tasks.html).

choices.text: Create a user with administrative access
choices.explanation: This task doesn't require root user access, but it does require that you have the proper permissions to create IAM users. AWS Documentation: [Tasks that require root user credentials](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/accounts/latest/reference/root-user-tasks.html).

choices.text: Configuring an Amazon S3 bucket to enable MFA (multi-factor authentication)
choices.explanation: This task can only be performed when you sign in as the root user of an account. This task was presented in the additional reading, "Tasks that require root user credentials," provided with the lesson. AWS Documentation: [Tasks that require root user credentials](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/accounts/latest/reference/root-user-tasks.html).

choices.text: Activate IAM access to the Billing and Cost Management console
choices.explanation: This task can only be performed when you sign in as the root user of an account. This task was presented in the additional reading, "Tasks that require root user credentials", provided with the lesson. AWS Documentation: [Tasks that require root user credentials](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/accounts/latest/reference/root-user-tasks.html).

You can use the AWS Support Plans console to change your support plan for your AWS account. To change your support plan, you must have AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) permissions or sign in to your account as a root user. For more information, see [Manage access to AWS Support Plans](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/awssupport/latest/user/security-support-plans.html) and [AWS managed policies for AWS Support Plans](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/awssupport/latest/user/managed-policies-aws-support-plans.html).

correctAnswers.text: Changing the email address associated with the account
correctAnswers.explanation: This task can only be performed when you sign in as the root user of an account. AWS Documentation: [Tasks that require root user credentials](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/accounts/latest/reference/root-user-tasks.html).

correctAnswers.text: Configuring an Amazon S3 bucket to enable MFA (multi-factor authentication)
correctAnswers.explanation: This task can only be performed when you sign in as the root user of an account. This task was presented in the additional reading, "Tasks that require root user credentials," provided with the lesson. AWS Documentation: [Tasks that require root user credentials](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/accounts/latest/reference/root-user-tasks.html).

correctAnswers.text: Activate IAM access to the Billing and Cost Management console
correctAnswers.explanation: This task can only be performed when you sign in as the root user of an account. This task was presented in the additional reading, "Tasks that require root user credentials", provided with the lesson. AWS Documentation: [Tasks that require root user credentials](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/accounts/latest/reference/root-user-tasks.html).

incorrectSelectedAnswers.text: Create a user with administrative access
incorrectSelectedAnswers.explanation: This task doesn't require root user access, but it does require that you have the proper permissions to create IAM users. AWS Documentation: [Tasks that require root user credentials](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/accounts/latest/reference/root-user-tasks.html).

You can use the AWS Support Plans console to change your support plan for your AWS account. To change your support plan, you must have AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) permissions or sign in to your account as a root user. For more information, see [Manage access to AWS Support Plans](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/awssupport/latest/user/security-support-plans.html) and [AWS managed policies for AWS Support Plans](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/awssupport/latest/user/managed-policies-aws-support-plans.html).

questions.questionText: Which types of deployments offer high availability?

choices.explanation: Single-Region deployments do not provide high availability.
Multi-Region deployments provide high availability. Systems that are highly available are dependable enough to operate continuously without failure.
Single-AZ deployments do not provide high availability.
Multi-AZ deployments provide high availability. Systems that are highly available are dependable enough to operate continuously without failure.

correctAnswers.explanation: Multi-Region deployments provide high availability. Systems that are highly available are dependable enough to operate continuously without failure.
Multi-AZ deployments provide high availability. Systems that are highly available are dependable enough to operate continuously without failure.

questions.questionText: A company wants to deploy applications entirely on a serverless platform. Which AWS service can they use to build their applications without worrying about managing servers?

choices.explanation: AWS CloudFormation allows you to use programming languages or a simple text file to model and provision, in an automated and secure manner, all the resources needed for your applications across all Regions and accounts. It is not what your team is looking for in this instance.

EC2 is, in fact, the AWS Cloud version of virtual servers. Additionally, when you configure EC2 instances, there is a management responsibility for these servers that would not be present in a serverless environment.

AWS Lambda lets you run code without provisioning or managing servers. You pay only for the compute time you consume.
https://aws.amazon.com/lambda/
ElastiCache is an in-memory data store and cache service. ElastiCache is not equipped to serve entire applications.

correctAnswers.explanation:
AWS Lambda lets you run code without provisioning or managing servers. You pay only for the compute time you consume.
https://aws.amazon.com/lambda/

incorrectSelectedAnswers.explanation: AWS CloudFormation allows you to use programming languages or a simple text file to model and provision, in an automated and secure manner, all the resources needed for your applications across all Regions and accounts. It is not what your team is looking for in this instance.

questions.questionText: For which services is DDoS protection via AWS Shield Advanced supported?

choices.explanation: GuardDuty is an intelligent threat detection system that uncovers unauthorized behavior.
DDoS protection via AWS Shield Advanced is supported for this service.
DDoS protection via AWS Shield Advanced is supported for this service.
DDoS protection via AWS Shield Advanced is supported for this service.

correctAnswers.explanation: DDoS protection via AWS Shield Advanced is supported for this service.
DDoS protection via AWS Shield Advanced is supported for this service.
DDoS protection via AWS Shield Advanced is supported for this service.

questions.questionText: Which of the following best describes EBS?

choices.explanation: EBS is not a managed database service.
EBS is used for storage and is attached to an instance.

choices.text: A virtual hard disk in the cloud
choices.explanation:
An EBS volume is best described as a virtual hard disk in the cloud - storage that, for all intents and purposes, appears to be directly attached to your instance. These are used by the virtual server instances in the cloud, which are known as EC2 instances.
https://aws.amazon.com/ebs/
EBS is not a database service.

correctAnswers.text: A virtual hard disk in the cloud
correctAnswers.explanation:
An EBS volume is best described as a virtual hard disk in the cloud - storage that, for all intents and purposes, appears to be directly attached to your instance. These are used by the virtual server instances in the cloud, which are known as EC2 instances.
https://aws.amazon.com/ebs/

questions.questionText: Which S3 storage class is the best value for long-term archive?

choices.explanation:
S3 Glacier Flexible Retrieval is a low-cost storage option for data archiving. It can provide retrieval in minutes or free bulk retrievals in 5-12 hours.

Reference: [Amazon S3 Storage Classes](https://aws.amazon.com/s3/storage-classes/)
S3 Standard is recommended for frequently accessed data, not for long-term storage.
The S3 Intelligent-Tiering storage class is designed to optimize costs by automatically moving data to the most cost-effective access tier, without performance impact or operational overhead.

If there is a need to retrieve the information quickly, then S3 Standard-IA may be the best choice; however, since time of retrieval was not specified as a requirement in this scenario, it does not provide the best value.

correctAnswers.explanation:
S3 Glacier Flexible Retrieval is a low-cost storage option for data archiving. It can provide retrieval in minutes or free bulk retrievals in 5-12 hours.

Reference: [Amazon S3 Storage Classes](https://aws.amazon.com/s3/storage-classes/)

questions.questionText: A customer wants to run an application on a local version of an EC2 instance in a disconnected environment. Which Snow Family device supports this?

choices.explanation: Snowcone allows you to collect, process, and move data to AWS using offline shipping or online using AWS DataSync. Snowball allows you to move huge amounts of data into and out of Amazon S3.

Snowball Edge storage-optimized offers on-board storage and compute power for select AWS capabilities. Snowball Edge can do local processing and edge-computing workloads in addition to transferring data between your local environment and the AWS Cloud. The storage-optimized version allows for greater storage benefits and is well suited for large-scale data migrations and recurring transfer workflows. Although this does have compute capabilities, it is not the best choice this scenario.
Snowmobile allows you to migrate or transport exabyte-scale datasets into and out of AWS.

Snowball Edge compute-optimized offers secure, on-board storage and compute power that can handle local processing and edge computing workloads in disconnected environments. The device utilizes AWS services such as Amazon EC2, Amazon EBS, Amazon S3, AWS IoT Greengrass, AWS Lambda functions, and AWS IAM to your edge environments for machine learning, data analytics, processing, and local storage. Snowball Edge compute-optimized offers more compute resources, such as a higher number of vCPUs and more memory, making it more suitable for running applications and processing requests and tasks locally than other devices in the Snow Family.

correctAnswers.explanation: Snowball Edge compute-optimized offers secure, on-board storage and compute power that can handle local processing and edge computing workloads in disconnected environments. The device utilizes AWS services such as Amazon EC2, Amazon EBS, Amazon S3, AWS IoT Greengrass, AWS Lambda functions, and AWS IAM to your edge environments for machine learning, data analytics, processing, and local storage. Snowball Edge compute-optimized offers more compute resources, such as a higher number of vCPUs and more memory, making it more suitable for running applications and processing requests and tasks locally than other devices in the Snow Family.

incorrectSelectedAnswers.explanation: Snowcone allows you to collect, process, and move data to AWS using offline shipping or online using AWS DataSync. Snowball allows you to move huge amounts of data into and out of Amazon S3.

questions.questionText: What is the most cost-effective AWS Support Plan if you want the full set of Trusted Advisor checks?

choices.explanation:
The Developer plan only provides 7 Trusted Advisor checks.
https://aws.amazon.com/premiumsupport/plans/

The Basic plan is the cheapest plan, but it does not have the full set of checks.
https://aws.amazon.com/premiumsupport/plans/

The Business plan is the cheapest plan that will still provide the full set of Trusted Advisor checks.
https://aws.amazon.com/premiumsupport/plans/

The Enterprise plan will provide the full set of Trusted Advisor checks, but it is the most expensive plan.
https://aws.amazon.com/premiumsupport/plans/

correctAnswers.explanation:
The Business plan is the cheapest plan that will still provide the full set of Trusted Advisor checks.
https://aws.amazon.com/premiumsupport/plans/

questions.questionText: Which of the below are you responsible for managing when storing data in S3?

choices.text: Who has access to the storage hardware
choices.explanation: This is a responsibility of AWS.

choices.text: Who has access to data you stored on the S3 service
choices.explanation:
Under the Shared Responsibility Model for managed services, AWS takes responsibility for managing all the hardware (including access, patching, and other maintenance). When it comes to S3, the customer is responsible for all aspects of the data being stored on S3, and who has access to manage the S3 service for that account.
https://aws.amazon.com/compliance/shared-responsibility-model/

choices.text: Who has access to the network hardware
choices.explanation: This is a responsibility of AWS.

choices.text: Who has access to the S3 infrastructure software
choices.explanation: This is a responsibility of AWS.

choices.text: Who has access to the S3 service
choices.explanation:
Under the Shared Responsibility Model for managed services, AWS takes responsibility for managing all the hardware (including access, patching, and other maintenance). When it comes to S3, the customer is responsible for all aspects of the data being stored on S3, and who has access to manage the S3 service for that account.
https://aws.amazon.com/compliance/shared-responsibility-model/

correctAnswers.text: Who has access to data you stored on the S3 service
correctAnswers.explanation:
Under the Shared Responsibility Model for managed services, AWS takes responsibility for managing all the hardware (including access, patching, and other maintenance). When it comes to S3, the customer is responsible for all aspects of the data being stored on S3, and who has access to manage the S3 service for that account.
https://aws.amazon.com/compliance/shared-responsibility-model/

correctAnswers.text: Who has access to the S3 service
correctAnswers.explanation:
Under the Shared Responsibility Model for managed services, AWS takes responsibility for managing all the hardware (including access, patching, and other maintenance). When it comes to S3, the customer is responsible for all aspects of the data being stored on S3, and who has access to manage the S3 service for that account.
https://aws.amazon.com/compliance/shared-responsibility-model/

questions.questionText: Which AWS service is specifically designed to assist you in processing large datasets?

choices.explanation:
EMR is a service that makes it easy to process large amounts of data efficiently.
https://aws.amazon.com/emr/

EC2 allows you to rent and manage virtual servers in the cloud. While you could run big data processing tasks on EC2, it will be easier on a different service that is been designed specifically for this purpose.
Redshift is a scalable data warehouse solution.
ElastiCache is a fully managed in-memory datastore compatible with Redis or Memcached that is used for caching data in memory for high-speed read access.

correctAnswers.explanation:
EMR is a service that makes it easy to process large amounts of data efficiently.
https://aws.amazon.com/emr/

incorrectSelectedAnswers.explanation: Redshift is a scalable data warehouse solution.

questions.questionText: Which of the following statements are true regarding AWS Reserved Instances?

choices.text: Reserved Instances act as a discount on new or existing On-Demand Instances.
choices.explanation: Reserved Instances act as a discount on new or existing On-Demand Instances. The discount is applied when you launch an instance with the required specifications.

choices.text: Convertible Reserved Instances can be exchanged for another Convertible Reserved Instance with different length contract terms.
choices.explanation: Convertible Reserved Instances terms are set at one or three years. Amazon EC2 Convertible Reserved Instances also cannot be sold. Convertible Reserved Instances can be exchanged during the term for another Convertible Reserved Instance with new attributes, including instance family, instance type, platform, scope, or tenancy.

choices.text: Reserved Instances usually have contract terms of one or three years. The longer the term, the higher the savings.
choices.explanation: Reserved Instances usually have contract terms of one or three years. Standard RIs provide the biggest discount for a designated instance type over a long-term contract. Convertible RIs provide a smaller discount but let you change the instance type.

choices.text: Reserved Instances are available in all up-front, partial up-front, or no upfront payments.
choices.explanation: Reserved Instances are available in all up-front (AURI), partial up-front (PURI), or no upfront payments (NURI). The more you pay up-front, the higher the savings.

correctAnswers.text: Reserved Instances act as a discount on new or existing On-Demand Instances.
correctAnswers.explanation: Reserved Instances act as a discount on new or existing On-Demand Instances. The discount is applied when you launch an instance with the required specifications.

correctAnswers.text: Reserved Instances usually have contract terms of one or three years. The longer the term, the higher the savings.
correctAnswers.explanation: Reserved Instances usually have contract terms of one or three years. Standard RIs provide the biggest discount for a designated instance type over a long-term contract. Convertible RIs provide a smaller discount but let you change the instance type.

correctAnswers.text: Reserved Instances are available in all up-front, partial up-front, or no upfront payments.
correctAnswers.explanation: Reserved Instances are available in all up-front (AURI), partial up-front (PURI), or no upfront payments (NURI). The more you pay up-front, the higher the savings.

AWS Support currently has five levels (1 free and 4 paid). The Basic plan is the free entitlement for all AWS Customers. The four paid support plans in order of ascending cost are Developer, Business, Enterprise On-Ramp and Enterprise. Start-up and Individual do not exist as Support Plans
https://aws.amazon.com/premiumsupport/compare-plans/

https://aws.amazon.com/premiumsupport/compare-plans/
Start-up and Individual do not exist as support plans provided by AWS Support.
Start-up and Individual do not exist as support plans provided by AWS Support.

https://aws.amazon.com/premiumsupport/compare-plans/

https://aws.amazon.com/premiumsupport/compare-plans/
